item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, January 26, 2025 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Hard numbers in the Wayland vs. X11 input latency discussion (262 points | 150 comments)
2. Amsterdam Compiler Kit for Cray X-MP (4 points | discuss)
3. So you wanna write Kubernetes controllers? (39 points | 17 comments)
4. Reviving a Dead Audio Format: The Return of ZZM (47 points | 5 comments)
5. Qwen2.5-1M: Deploy your own Qwen with context length up to 1M tokens (33 points | 35 comments)
6. Show HN: A new native app for 20 year old OS X (34 points | 2 comments)
7. Former tech CEO suing to get the record of his arrest removed from the internet (115 points | 67 comments)
8. 100 years of Bell Labs [pdf] (36 points | 2 comments)
9. Steam Brick: No screen, no controller, just a power button and a USB port (772 points | 221 comments)
10. The protester's guide to smartphone security (168 points | 77 comments)
11. DeepSeek-R1: Incentivizing Reasoning Capability in LLMs via RL (1095 points | 915 comments)
12. Using the most unhinged AVX-512 instruction to make fastest phrase search algo (34 points | 6 comments)
13. The impact of competition and DeepSeek on Nvidia (11 points | 10 comments)
14. Ancient genomes reveal an Iron Age society centred on women (11 points | 4 comments)
15. Another undersea cable damaged in Baltic Sea (19 points | 11 comments)
16. Two Bites of Data Science in K (4 points | discuss)
17. Show HN: Orange intelligence, an open source alternative to Apple Intelligence (19 points | 3 comments)
18. Show HN: SimpleSearch – Just a list of search bars (12 points | 15 comments)
19. OpenRA – Classic strategy games rebuilt for the modern era (563 points | 105 comments)
20. AI slop, suspicion, and writing back (175 points | 131 comments)
21. GPT-4o-powered cleaning robot (built in 4 days) (13 points | 4 comments)
22. The South Vietnamese pilot who landed a Cessna on a carrier to save his family (2019) (315 points | 157 comments)
23. Explainer: What's R1 and Everything Else? (194 points | 86 comments)
24. Every HTML Element (432 points | 122 comments)
25. YC Graveyard: 821 inactive Y Combinator startups (315 points | 189 comments)
26. An invalid 68030 instruction accidentally allowed the Mac Classic II to boot (280 points | 56 comments)
27. I Built an Omni-Directional Ball-Wheeled Bike [video] (83 points | 10 comments)
28. Apache Iceberg (173 points | 53 comments)
29. The Simplicity of Prolog (159 points | 78 comments)
30. SigNoz (YC W21) Is hiring back end engineers to build open-source Datadog ( | hide)
